Hey tipassoi,
 
A few things to remember about Heritrix. 
 
1. It's only su=
pported on Linux. When running on Linux, the directions in
the User Manual =
should be more then adequate to get you up and running.
 
2. The fact that =
Heritrix runs on Windows at all is more a matter of luck
then planning. Som=
e of the developers (me included) develop on Windows, but
we use the Eclips=
e environment to run the program. When testing builds even
I (the most Wind=
ows oriented amongst the devs) use a Linux box.
 
3. You can run a build on=
 Windows, but it requires a bit of expert
attention. I seem to recall sever=
al messages in this forum about the subject
awhile back. It might be worth =
to checking the archive, and this message in
particular http://groups.yahoo=
.com/group/archive-crawler/message/1141
 
4. In general using Heritrix requ=
ires a certain amount of computer savvy, it
simply isn't designed with the =
novice user in mind. 
 
You never did say what you wanted to do with Heritr=
ix, so I can only
speculate,  but you might want to take a look at a more u=
ser friendly
alternative like HTTrack (http://www.httrack.com/). It is not =
as feature
rich as Heritrix, nor does it offer a the same open architecture=
, but it is
quite good if all you want to do is fetch and store the content=
s of a
particular web site on your hard disk.
 
- Kris
